intro: Naucleopsis chiguila, commonly known as the Chiguila tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It produces small, round berries that are edible and have a mild, sweet flavor. The tree is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
